text: Hello - Does anyone know if creating dynamic pages with query data will bypass the apparent limit of 10 dynamic pages per CRM object type? I.e. I need like 100 dynamic pages for the same CRM object, as I administer like 80 domains. Can I just create multiple queries and assign them to different pages?
Where have you red about that 10 dynamic page limit?
Unfortunately, only via an error message when attempting to publish the (presumably 11th) page.

That must be a bug...it doesn't make sense to waste time developing a custom template to render pages automatically for just 10 records, in the KB they mention like 10k rows or even more <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/dynamic-pages/crm-objects> i'll reach out to HubSpot support with that screenshot to confirm if that's the case
To clarify there are 10+ different dynamic pages for 1200+ CRM records. I administer ~80 domains, and each domain needs to display its subset of the relevant CRM records.

HubDB notes a limitation of “<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/hubdb#hubdb-technical-limits|10 dynamic pages per HubDB table>”, but no such limitation is noted on the corresponding CRM Objects page.
aaaaa ok that makes sense, then I guess we have the same limitation for crm objects too, but it's better to ask HubSpot support for confirmation
yes, we recently introduced the limitation few months ago for all dynamic pages.

>  each domain needs to display its subset of the relevant CRM records
<@U03CGBABA8M> So each set of dynamic page just gets a unique subset of records from the table / custom object? If so is creating separate table for each subset of data an option for you?
cc <@U6W3H6YN8> <@U05MR4GF5UY> <@U024L8W0MB6>
<@U03CGBABA8M> if you could extrapolate on your use case a bit more, that would be great. Why do you want so many versions of these dynamic pages?

Thanks <@UG52C29EE> and <@U6W3H6YN8>. The use case is: we have our national organization, and local “chapters”. Our National website needs to display all these CRM `p_campaign_victory` records (representing one measure of our national impact), and each chapter (on its own domain) needs to display a subset of the data. Sometimes these subsets are overlapping - for example, if two chapters are involved in the same real world thing recorded as a `p_campaign_victory`.
<@UG52C29EE> HubDB does not work for this use case: no workflows available, the fragmentation in different tables doesn’t work for the scenario, the CRM object ownership model is a more natural fit.
And to confirm, the chapter websites need to show a listing of the objects, as well as the detail pages? Rather than the detail pages living on the national website?
Correct - there’s a geographic context that makes a strong need to keep the listings + details on the same domain.
And for each domain, you want the duplicate dynamically generated instance page showing up in site search, sitemap, analytics, etc.?
How many instances are in that CRM object?
Yes to site search, sitemap, etc. There are planned to be 2 per domain, although I might be able to condense that if need be.
To confirm, do you mean there are only 2 p_campaign_victory instances per domain? How many total p_campaign_victory instances are there?
There are 2 dynamic pages using p_campaign_victory per domain, and I have a need on 79 domains now, and another possible 10 in the near-term.
Sorry, I am wondering how many unique p_campaign_victory instances there are in your CRM.
And what is your use case of 2 dynamic pages per domain? Is this not just creating a duplicate page for each instance? What is different about the two dynamic page setups?

Partially, because of minor content differences, which could be handled in the custom module. Mostly the need to show a subset of data on each listing page, and access the detail page at the correct path. E.g. “Active New York Work” should be accessed at /campaign/active+new+york+work, and “Victory 2" should be accessed at /victory/victory+2. Internally, we distinguish these with a “status” field.
Gotchya. And how many unique p_campaign_victory instances are there in that CRM object?

Just so you know, the subset you filter out in the listing page will still have dynamic pages generated, which will show up in your sitemap, site search, analytics, etc. so you might consider to split them up into two objects.
I think we’re talking past each other here. I’d be happy to talk with you privately and walk you through our org if it would be easier.
Sure, feel free to book me here! <https://app.HubSpot.com/meetings/wspiro>

Thanks - booked for now! Are you asking “how many different unique p_campaign_victory records?” We have about 1200 records right now. So the websites for national, nyc, and long island would each have their listing page, but would all reference the same actual CRM record titled, “Active New York Work”
